Reason: The 'counter_cache_save_period' configuration is considered performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the configuration directly impacts system performance by determining how frequently the counter cache keys are saved. The code initializes the counter cache and schedules the saving of keys based on this configuration. A shorter save period may result in more frequent disk writes, potentially affecting system performance, while a longer save period may lead to stale data in the cache. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can have a notable impact on system performance at the system level.
